case_vignette:
A 21-year-old male presents for evaluation of a painful rash on his right index finger. He reports a tingling sensation prior to the eruption of red small spots that became more yellow and pus filled. He denies any trauma or topical products applied to the area. He has a history of cold sores on the lips. Physical examination reveals multiple clustered painful, white-yellow vesicles on the right index finger on erythematous pink base. The patient is a college student and is otherwise healthy.

The patient is a college student and is otherwise healthy.

question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm experiencing a painful rash on my right index finger that started with a tingling sensation and developed into red spots that turned yellow and pus-filled.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for a short period before the red spots appeared and then turned yellow and pus-filled.
Do you have any known allergies or a history of skin conditions?
I have a history of cold sores on my lips, but no other known allergies or skin conditions.
Have you had any recent exposure to substances or environments that could have irritated your skin, or any recent injuries to the affected area?
No, I haven't had any recent exposure to substances or environments that could have irritated my skin, nor have I had any recent injuries to the affected area.
Is the rash isolated to your finger, or have you noticed similar symptoms anywhere else on your body?
The rash is isolated to my right index finger; I haven't noticed similar symptoms anywhere else on my body.
Final Diagnosis: Herpetic Whitlow
